vote.title: McCain Amdt. No. 3355; To strike funding for the emergency forest restoration program.

vote.question: On the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Proceed to Consider S.Con.Res. 44; A concurrent resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2013 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2014 through 2022.

vote.question: On the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Proceed to Consider S.Con.Res. 42; A concurrent resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2013, revising the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal year 2012, and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2013 through 2022.

vote.question: On the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Proceed to Consider S.Con.Res. 37; A concurrent resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2013, and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2014 through 2022.

vote.question: On the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Proceed to Consider H.Con.Res. 112; A concurrent resolution establishing the budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2013 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2014 through 2022.

vote.question: On the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Proceed to Consider S. Con. Res. 41; A concurrent resolution setting forth the President's budget request for the United States Government for fiscal year 2013, and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2014 through 2022.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: H.R. 2072; A bill to reauthorize the Export-Import Bank of the United States, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2104
vote.title: Toomey Amdt. No. 2104; To prohibit an increase in the lending authority of the Export-Import Bank of the United States to more than $100,000,000,000 until the Secretary of the Treasury certifies that the Secretary has initiated international negotiations to eliminate export financing programs and to prohibit an increase in that lending authority to more than $120,000,000,000 until a multilateral agreement to eliminate export financing programs has been completed.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2103
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 2103; To clarify the requirement that the Export-Import Bank of the United States not make or guarantee loans that are subordinate to other loans, to restrict financing of certain fossil fuel projects in foreign countries, and to prohibit financing of renewable energy products manufactured in foreign countries.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2102
vote.title: Corker Amdt. No. 2102; To require the Export-Import Bank of the United States to provide financing only for transactions subsidized by export credit agencies of other countries or for which private sector financing is unavailable or prohibitively expensive and to require the Bank to maintain a ratio of capital to the outstanding principal balance of loans and loan guarantees of not less than 10 percent.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2101
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 2101; To prohibit the Export-Import Bank of the United States from providing financing to a person or for a project in a country the government or central bank of which holds debt instruments of the United States.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2100
vote.title: Lee Amdt. No. 2100; To phase out the authority of the Export-Import Bank of the United States and to require the President to initiate negotiations with other major exporting countries to end subsidized export financing programs.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation John J. Tharp, Jr., of Illinois, to be United States District Judge for the Northern District of Illinois

vote.question: On Cloture on the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to Consider S. 2343; A bill to amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to extend the reduced interest rate for Federal Direct Stafford Loans, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Jacqueline H. Nguyen, of California, to be U.S. Circuit Judge for the Ninth Circuit

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S. 1925 as Amended; A bill to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act of 1994.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2095
vote.title: Hutchison Amdt. No. 2095; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2086
vote.title: Cornyn Amdt. No. 2086; To amend title 18 of the United States Code and other provisions of law to strengthen provisions of the Violence Against Women Act and improve justice for crime victims.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2094
vote.title: Klobuchar Amdt. No. 2094; To provide Debbie Smith grants for auditing sexual assault evidence backlogs.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Gregg Jeffrey Costa, of Texas, to be U.S. District Judge for the Southern District of Texas

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S. 1789 as Amended; A bill to improve, sustain, and transform the United States Postal Service.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2046
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 2046; To provide protections for postal workers with respect to their right not to subsidize union nonrepresentational activities.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2042
vote.title: Casey Amdt. No. 2042; To maintain current delivery time for market-dominant products.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2039
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 2039; To prohibit employees of the United States Postal Service from engaging in collective bargaining.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2028
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 2028; To establish a pilot program to test alternative methods for the delivery of postal services.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2079
vote.title: Manchin Amdt. No. 2079; To extend the moratorium on the closing and consolidation of postal facilities or post offices, stations, or branches.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2025
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 2025; To end the mailbox use monopoly.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2049
vote.title: Akaka Amdt. No. 2049; To allow supervisory and other managerial organizations to participate in the planning and development of changes in, or termination of, pay policies and schedules and fringe benefit programs.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2083
vote.title: Corker Amdt. No. 2083; To improve the bill.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2034
vote.title: Akaka Amdt. No. 2034; To provide appropriate workers compensation for Federal employees.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2043
vote.title: Udall (NM) Amdt. No. 2043; To strike the limitations on changes to mail delivery schedule, with an offset.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2061
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 2061 As Modified; To achieve long-term cost-savings by allowing the Postmaster General to reduce the postal workforce through mandatory retirements for eligible employees.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2033
vote.title: McCain Amdt. No. 2033; To establish the Commission on Postal Reorganization.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 2000
vote.title: Motion to Waive All Applicable Budgetary Discipline Re: Amdt. No. 2000 As Modified; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Proceed to Consider S. J. Res. 36; A joint resolution providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the National Labor Relations Board relating to representation election procedures.

vote.title: Confirmation Brian C. Wimes, of Missouri, to be U.S. District Judge for the Eastern and Western Districts of Missouri

vote.title: Confirmation Stephanie Dawn Thacker, of West Virginia, to be U.S. Circuit Judge for the Fourth Circuit

vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to Consider S.1789; A bill to improve, sustain, and transform the United States Postal Service.

vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to Consider S.2204; A bill to eliminate unnecessary tax subsidies and promote renewable energy and energy conservation.

vote.title: Confirmation Ronnie Abrams, of New York, to be U.S. District Judge for the Southern District of New York

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: H.R. 3606 As Amended; A bill to increase American job creation and economic growth by improving access to the public capital markets for emerging growth companies.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1884
vote.title: Merkley Amdt. No. 1884; To amend the securities laws to provide for registration exemptions for certain crowdfunded securities, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on H.R. 3606; A bill to increase American job creation and economic growth by improving access to the public capital markets for emerging growth companies.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 1836
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Cantwell Amdt. No. 1836; To reauthorize the Export-Import Bank of the United States.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 1833
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Reed Amdt. No. 1833; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Michael Walter Fitzgerald, of California, to be U.S. District Judge

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Gina Marie Groh, of West Virginia, to be U.S. District Judge

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S. 1813 As Amended; A bill to reauthorize Federal-aid highway and highway safety construction programs, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 1556
vote.title: Motion to Waive All Applicable Budgetary Disciple Re: Paul Amdt. No. 1556; To permit emergency exemptions from compliance with certain laws for highway construction projects.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1816
vote.title: Boxer Amdt. No. 1816; To express the sense of the Senate that Federal agencies should ensure that all applicable environmental reviews, approvals, licensing, and permit requirements under Federal law are completed on an expeditious basis after a disaster or emergency.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1742
vote.title: Portman Amdt. No. 1742; To allow States to permit nonhighway uses in rest areas along any highway.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 1785
vote.title: Motion to Waive All Applicable Budgetary Provisions Re: Corker Amdt. No. 1785, As Modified; To lower the FY13 discretionary budget authority cap as set in the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 by $11,000,000,000 in order to offset the general fund transfers to the Highway Trust Fund.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1736
vote.title: Portman Amdt. No. 1736; To free States to spend gas taxes on their transportation priorities.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1517
vote.title: Coats Amdt. No. 1517; To modify the apportionment formula to ensure that the percentage of apportioned funds received by a State is the same as the percentage of total gas taxes paid by the State.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1782
vote.title: Menendez Amdt. No. 1782; To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify certain tax credits relating to energy, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1589
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 1589; To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to terminate certain energy tax subsidies and lower the corporate income tax rate.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1812
vote.title: Stabenow Amdt. No. 1812 As Modified; To prevent a tax increase on American businesses and to provide certainty to job creators by extending certain expiring tax credits relating to energy.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1826
vote.title: Roberts Amdt. No. 1826 As Modified; Of a perfecting nature.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1759
vote.title: Bingaman Amdt. No. 1759; To remove privatized highways from consideration in apportioning highway funding among States.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1756
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 1756; To return to the individual States maximum discretionary authority and fiscal responsibility for all elements of the national surface transportation systems that are not within the direct purview of the Federal Government.

vote.question: On the Motion
vote.title: Motion to Waive All Applicable Budgetary Discipline Re: S.1813; A bill to reauthorize Federal-aid highway and highway safety construction programs, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1537
vote.title: Hoeven Amdt. No. 1537; To approve the Keystone XL pipeline project and provide for environmental protection and government oversight.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1817
vote.title: Wyden Amdt. No. 1817; To ensure the expeditious processing of Keystone XL permit applications consistent with current law, prohibit the export of crude oil produced in Canada and transported by the Keystone XL pipeline and related facilities unless the prohibition is waived by the President, and require the use of United States iron, steel, and manufactured goods in the construction of the Keystone XL pipeline and related facilities with certain exceptions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1822
vote.title: Nelson (FL) Amdt. No. 1822; To provide for the restoration of the natural resources, ecosystems, fisheries, marine and wildlife habitats, beaches, and coastal wetlands of Gulf Coast States and to provide funding for the Land and Water Conservation Fund.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1738
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 1738; To prevent the creation of duplicative and overlapping Federal programs.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1660
vote.title: Collins Amdt. No. 1660; To provide additional time for the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to issue achievable standards for industrial, commercial, and institutional boilers, process heaters, and incinerators.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1825
vote.title: Baucus Amdt. No. 1825; To reauthorize for 1 year the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 and to provide full funding for the Payments in Lieu of Taxes program for 1 year, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1535
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 1535; To provide for an extension of the Draft Proposed Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Program 2010-2015.

vote.title: Confirmation Thomas Owen Rice, of Washington, to be U.S. District Judge

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Mary Elizabeth Phillips, of Missouri, to be U.S. District Judge

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 1761
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Reid Amdt No. 1761 to S. 1813; Of a perfecting nature.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1520
vote.title: Motion to Table Blunt Amdt. No. 1520; To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to protect rights of conscience with regard to requirements for coverage of specific items and services.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Margo Kitsy Brodie, of New York, to be U.S. District Judge for the Eastern District of New York

vote.question: On the Conference Report
vote.title: Conference Report to Accompany H.R. 3630; A bill to extend the payroll tax holiday, unemployment compensation, Medicare physician payment, provide for the consideration of the Keystone XL pipeline, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Jesse M. Furman, of New York, to be United States District Judge

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 1633
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Reid Amdt. No. 1633; Of a perfecting nature.

vote.title: Confirmation Adalberto Jose Jordan, of Florida, to be U.S. Circuit Judge for the Eleventh Circuit

vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Nomination of Adalberto Jose Jordan, of Florida, to be U.S. Circuit Judge

vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to S. 1813; A bill to reauthorize Federal-aid highway and highway safety construction programs, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Cathy Ann Bencivengo, of California, to be U.S. District Judge

vote.question: On the Conference Report
vote.title: Conference Report to Accompany H.R. 658; A bill to amend title 49, United States Code, to authorize appropriations for the Federal Aviation Administration for fiscal years 2011 through 2014, to streamline programs, create efficiencies, reduce waste, and improve aviation safety and capacity, to provide stable funding for the national aviation system, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S. 2038 As Amended; An original bill to prohibit Members of Congress and employees of Congress from using nonpublic information derived from their official positions for personal benefit, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1481
vote.title: Brown (OH) Amdt. No. 1481 As Modified; To prohibit financial conflicts of interest by Senators and staff.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1493
vote.title: Grassley Amdt. No. 1493; To require disclosure of political intelligence activities under Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1488
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 1488; To express the sense of the Senate that the Senate should pass a joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution that limits the number of terms a Member of Congress may serve.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1473
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 1473; To prevent the creation of duplicative and overlapping Federal programs.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1500
vote.title: Inhofe Amdt. No. 1500; To prohibit unauthorized earmarks.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1472
vote.title: Toomey Amdt. No. 1472; To prohibit earmarks.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1491
vote.title: Shelby Amdt. No. 1491 As Modified; To extend the STOCK Act to ensure that the reporting requirements set forth in the STOCK Act apply to the executive branch and independent agencies.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1511
vote.title: Lieberman Amdt. No. 1511; To extend the STOCK Act to ensure that the reporting requirements set forth in the STOCK Act apply to the executive branch and independent agencies.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1487
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 1487; To prohibit executive branch appointees or staff holding positions that give them oversight, rule-making, loan or grant-making abilities over industries or companies in which they or their spouse have a significant financial interest.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1484
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 1484; To require Members of Congress to certify that they are not trading using material, non-public information.

vote.question: On Cloture on the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to Consider S. 2038; An original bill to prohibit Members of Congress and employees of Congress from using nonpublic information derived from their official positions for personal benefit, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Proceed to Consider H.J. Res. 98; A joint resolution relating to the disapproval of the President's exercise of authority to increase the debt limit, as submitted under section 3101A of title 31, United States Code, on January 12, 2012.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation John M. Gerrard, of Nebraska, to be U.S. District Judge for the District of Nebraska
